glsa.title: OpenVPN: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: The OpenVPN client is potentially vulnerable to the execution of arbitrary code and the OpenVPN server is vulnerable to a Denial of Service issue.

background.p: OpenVPN is a multi-platform, full-featured SSL VPN solution.

description.p: The OpenVPN client contains a format string bug in the handling of the foreign_option in options.c. Furthermore, when the OpenVPN server runs in TCP mode, it may dereference a NULL pointer under specific error conditions.

impact.p: A remote attacker could setup a malicious OpenVPN server and trick the user into connecting to it, potentially executing arbitrary code on the client's computer. A remote attacker could also exploit the NULL dereference issue by sending specific packets to an OpenVPN server running in TCP mode, resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: Do not use "pull" or "client" options in the OpenVPN client configuration file, and use UDP mode for the OpenVPN server.
